level.text: The following uses and structures shall be permitted as special exceptions in an R-4 District if approved by the Board of Zoning Adjustment under § 3104:
The uses and structures permitted in an R-3 District under § 322.1 not permitted as a matter of right under § 330.5; and

Telephone exchange, if declared necessary in the public interest by the Public Utilities Commission, and subject to requirements for setback, screening, or other safeguards as the Board deems necessary for the protection of neighboring property.

A college or university use permitted in an R-3 District under § 322.2, not permitted as a matter of right under § 330.5 shall be permitted as a special exception in an R-4 District if approved by the Zoning Commission under § 3104.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: § 3104.4 of the Zoning Regulations, effective May 12, 1958; as amended by Final Rulemaking published at 47 DCR 9725, 9731 (December 8, 2000).
